decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Combo pieces, such as Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan, to generate powerful board presence and mana advantage. Karn, the Great Creator is utilized to access key artifacts, while Sakura-Tribe Scout and Azusa, Lost but Seeking help ramp up to the combo pieces faster. The deck includes a toolbox of lands to support the combo, with cards like Boros Garrison and Gemstone Mine providing additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and efficient land plays to secure victory.

The deck revolves around controlling the game through various means such as counterspells, removal, and planeswalkers. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Cryptic Command, the player can dictate the pace of the game while maintaining card advantage. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats on the board. The mana base ensures consistency with access to both white and blue mana sources. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to deal direct damage to the opponent while also utilizing cheap spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The main strategy is to flood the board with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also potentially drawing additional cards and maintaining a strong tempo with cards like Light Up the Stage and Faithless Looting. The deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of burn spells and recurring threats, aiming to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Puresteel Paladin and Sram, Senior Edificer, along with zero-cost equipment cards like Paradise Mantle and Mox Opal to generate infinite mana and draw cards. The deck also utilizes Retract to bounce all equipment back to hand for more draws and repeats. The deck can then finish off the opponent with a large Grapeshot or Monastery Mentor tokens. The key strategy is to efficiently cycle through the deck to find the combo pieces and execute the combo as quickly as possible.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a lethal combination of cards to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent as fast as possible. This is achieved through utilizing efficient pump spells like Vines of Vastwood, Mutagenic Growth, and Might of Old Krosa, along with evasive threats like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent to bypass blockers. The inclusion of creatures like Noble Hierarch and Inkmoth Nexus also help to accelerate this game plan, allowing for explosive wins in a short amount of time.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells using cards like Thought Scour, Faithless Looting, and Manamorphose to activate Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck also utilizes low casting cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot to control the board and protect the Phoenix. Pyromancer Ascension is used to double the effectiveness of spells, while Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake provide additional threats to close out the game. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and trigger Pyromancer Ascension. It aims to be aggressive by casting cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Faithless Looting to power up the Phoenix and control the board with Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake. The inclusion of Saheeli, Sublime Artificer adds another threat to the board and can generate tokens to further pressure the opponent. Surgical Extraction and Set Adrift provide disruption against the opponent's strategy. The deck excels at quickly overwhelming opponents with powerful threats.

Utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana, this control deck aims to stall opponents with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone before ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated. The deck's consistency is reinforced by its ability to search for key cards with Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying, making it a formidable force against a variety of strategies in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating to boost their power. Arcbound Ravager can sacrifice artifacts to grow larger and transfer counters, while Steel Overseer can pump up the team. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive onslaught of creatures. Experimental Frenzy allows for card advantage and potential explosive turns. With powerful synergy between artifacts and creatures, this deck aims to win before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to abuse graveyard mechanics to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. Through cards like Cathartic Reunion, Faithless Looting, and Life from the Loam, the deck aims to consistently dredge (or mill) cards into the graveyard to bring back creatures and deal damage to opponents. Additionally, cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate provide additional reach and damage potential, making it a fast and explosive combo deck that can overwhelm opponents with graveyard value and aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on quickly playing high-impact Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, using ramp from Tron lands and Expedition Map to power them out ahead of schedule. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable provide additional value and disruption, while Chalice of the Void locks opponents out of low-cost spells. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast threats while disrupting their game plan, ultimately winning through aggressive creature attacks and powerful Eldrazi abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting, Burning Inquiry, and Street Wraith, in order to cheat out powerful threats like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to clear the way for attacks, ultimately seeking to win the game through fast, explosive plays and relentless aggression.

This deck focuses on a balance of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to apply early pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to quickly establish a board presence, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the game and close it out quickly. The inclusion of removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Fatal Push, as well as versatile cards like Liliana of the Veil, provide answers to various threats while maintaining a proactive game plan. The mana base is built to support a wide range of spells and enable smooth gameplay.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with counter spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan. This deck aims to control the board state, protect its threats, and ultimately outvalue the opponent by drawing extra cards and managing resources efficiently. With a blend of card advantage, disruption, and win conditions like Celestial Colonnade, UW Control is designed to grind out victories through strategic decision making and precise sequencing of spells.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage provided by powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. With a combination of board wipes like Supreme Verdict and targeted removal like Path to Exile, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing into more answers with cards like Opt and Hieroglyphic Illumination. The deck also includes utility lands like Celestial Colonnade and Field of Ruin to further control the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through planeswalkers and Snapcaster Mage. The deck includes a variety of counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats, along with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the board. In addition, the deck includes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Serum Visions to help filter and draw cards, ensuring that the player has the necessary answers to control the game and secure victory.
